summary: This document is an email chain from July 2023 between attorney Jeanne M. Christensen and an unnamed recipient, likely a federal prosecutor. Christensen forwards a news article and expresses outrage that criminal charges have not been brought against financier Leon Black, citing his $62.5 million settlement with the US Virgin Islands over the Epstein probe and allegations he sexually assaulted multiple women.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: She is the sender of the primary email, advocating for criminal investigation of Leon Black based on his settlement with the US Virgin Islands and allegations of sexual assault.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: He is the subject of the email, accused of paying a $62.5 million settlement to the US Virgin Islands related to the Epstein probe and allegedly sexually assaulting multiple women.

persons.name: Jane
persons.context: Mentioned as having passed along Jeanne Christensen's initial email to the unnamed recipient.

connections.description: Christensen is advocating for a criminal investigation against Black, indicating she is acting in a legal capacity, potentially representing victims or as a concerned attorney.

events.title: Reuters reports Leon Black settlement with USVI
events.description: News article reports that financier Leon Black paid $62.5 million to the US Virgin Islands to settle its probe into his dealings with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email correspondence regarding Leon Black
events.description: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen corresponds with a federal prosecutor, urging a criminal investigation into Leon Black based on the settlement and allegations he sexually assaulted women.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Leon Black paid a $62.5 million settlement to the US Virgin Islands related to its Jeffrey Epstein probe.
Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen alleges that Leon Black has also made payments to individual women and that one lawyer represents ten women who accuse him of sexual assault.
Christensen expresses outrage that criminal charges have not been brought against Leon Black and urges the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to investigate.
The email indicates the SDNY's Civil Rights Unit is handling all trafficking matters as of July 2023.
